summary: The TRICARE Travel Improvement Act aims to amend United States Code Title 10, concerning travel expenses for specialty care under the TRICARE program. The bill reduces the distance threshold for the Secretary of Defense to reimburse travel expenses from 100 miles to 50 miles, impacting active duty members and, with a specific provision, military retirees and their dependents. The bill also includes edits to the sections concerning exceptional circumstances. Its ultimate goal is to facilitate reimbursement for travel expenses surrounding specialty care.
